intro: Chytroma holcogyne, commonly known as the Holcogyne lichen, is a foliose lichen that thrives in moist, shaded environments. It is characterized by its greenish-yellow thallus with a distinct, granular texture. The plant forms a symbiotic relationship with algae, which provides the necessary photosynthetic function. It is often found on tree trunks and rocks in temperate regions. Due to its slow growth and sensitivity to environmental changes, it is considered an indicator species for ecological health.
